none: Ijāza li-Sīdiya b. al-Mukhtār b. al-Hayba al-Intashā’ī
Al-Mukhtār b. Muḥammad b. al-Mukhtār b. Aḥmad b. Abī Bakr al-Kuntī al-Wāfī
Ijāza to Shaykh Sīdiyyā from Al-Mukhtār al-Saghīr (d. 1846)

An ijāza (authorization, permission, or license) of the Qādiriyya Sufi order. Issued around 1820 by Al-Mukhtār al-Ṣaghīr of the Kunta family of the Saharan West, to influential Mauritanian scholar Shaykh Sīdiyyā (d. 1868), it grants Sīdiyyā an absolute, general authorization to initiate, study, and transmit the esoteric knowledge and secrets that he learned in the context of his initiation into the Qādiriyya.
